TopicTitle: Kerbal-Kon 2015: Can We Make It Happen?

Articles.Content:
> 
> I want this. I want it now.
> I also want it in Texas.

Wafle, NOBODY wants to go to Texas in the summer.

> 
> Wafle, NOBODY wants to go to Texas in the summer.

C'mon now, it's not \_that\_ bad. It's only been about 90 Ã‚ÂºF here in Houston for the whole month of June. And it rained yesterday. And the day before that. And the whole month before that. [http://paintraincomic.com/comic/heat-stroke/](http://paintraincomic.com/comic/heat-stroke/) Don't ask about the mosquito air force. The trick to surviving Texas in Summer is to never go outside.

> 
> Wafle, NOBODY wants to go to Texas in the summer.

Nor Oklahoma for that matter, way too hot to go outside.

> 
> C'mon now, it's not \_that\_ bad. It's only been about 90 Ã‚ÂºF here in Houston for the whole month of June. And it rained yesterday. And the day before that. And the whole month before that. [http://paintraincomic.com/comic/heat-stroke/](http://paintraincomic.com/comic/heat-stroke/) Don't ask about the mosquito air force. The trick to surviving Texas in Summer is to never go outside.

Mosquito air force? \*runs\*

A few questions, one: is this still going to happen? It seems like it is stalled.

How would we set up the convention? 

What would we do for food and drinks?

Vendors?

Merch?

How many event days? 2 or 3?

Estimate of average attendance per day?

> 
> A few questions, one: is this still going to happen? It seems like it is stalled.
> How would we set up the convention? 
> 
> What would we do for food and drinks?
> 
> Vendors?
> 
> Merch?
> 
> How many event days? 2 or 3?
> 
> Estimate of average attendance per day?

My guess is that it won't happen this year. Maybe next year, but we'll see.
